Affiliations

2018-present

Leibniz Universität Hannover, Germany

In 2018 I joined the PhD program in Physics offered by the Institut für Theoretische Physik at LUH with funding from DAAD . I was lucky to have an understanding supervisor in Olaf Lechtenfeld who has helped me write 3 research papers so far. I feel confident about finishing my PhD dissertation next year before the funding expires with a few more research papers in hand. I have also attended several conferences and summer schools in and around Germany. In particular, the yearly Saalburg Summer Schools have been especially helpful in providing a first hand experience of several research avenues of modern era.

2015-2018

Indian Institute of Science Education & Research, Kolkata, India

I then enrolled in the Integrated PhD program of the Deparment of Physical Sciences at IISER-K in order to get a proper training as far the courseworks are concerned. This proved greatly beneficial for me as I was able to complete several courses, including some from the Mathematics department, that were offered by very competent faculty members over an intensive 3 year period. I also further collaborated with Biswajit Chakrabarty by visiting S N Bose Centre during summer breaks to produce 2 more research papers. I finally graduated from IISER-K in 2018 with a Masters degree to continue a PhD program in Germany.

2010-2015

Indian Institute of Technology (BHU), Varanasi, India

I first joined the 5 year dual-degree (Bachelor+Master) program of the Department of Biochemical Engineering at IIT(BHU) with an aim of persuing research in Biotechnology. It was, however, by the end of 2nd year that I discovered my passion for theoretical physics. Having already spend 2 years there I decided to finish the degree program while learning the various physics subjects on my own during spare times. I later came in contact with Biswajit Chakraborty with whom I published my first research article before graduating in 2015. Prof. Chakrabarty had a very significant impact on my research career and I would go on to publish more papers with him later.

Teaching

Leibniz Universität Hannover, Germany

  1. I was the teaching assistant for the course Lie groups, Algebra and their Representations conducted by my supervisor, Olaf Lechtenfeld, during the summer semester of 2019. I conducted the exercise sessions and also took a few extra classes. It was a very fruitful experience for me as I learned many new things.
  2. I have also conducted 2 revision courses, which are held near the end of the semester to revise the course contents over an intensive 1 week period. The first one was for the Mathematical Methods of Physics course in the winter semester of 2019-20 and the other one was for the Introduction to Quantum Theory course in the summer semester of 2020.

Indian Institute of Science Education & Research, Kolkata, India

  1. I was one of the teaching assistants for the Intermediate Electricity and Magnetism course conducted by Ananda Dasgupta during the Spring semester of 2017. I was tasked with grading the homework assignments and I also prepared solutions to some exercise sheets. This was a fun experience particularly because of the unique teaching style of Ananda Dasgupta.
  2. I was also the teaching assistant for the Advanced Mathematical Methods of Physics course conducted by Sunandan Gangopadhyay in the Autum semester of 2017. The course covered several important topics of Topology and Differential geometry. I prepared and graded the homework assignments.

Achievements

I have been very fortunate in that most most of my study/research so far have been financed through scholarships of one kind or another. Below I list the prominent ones:
  1. I was awarded the prestigious DAAD Doctoral fellowship in 2018 for a period of 4 years through a screening process that involved submitting a research proposal followed by a personal interview.
  2. In 2016 I secured the Junior Research Fellowship (JRF) funding by passing the NET examination biannually conducted by CSIR+UGC.
  3. I was later selected in the famous Super-30 program in 2009 through a competetive 2-step screening process for an intensive IIT-JEE preparation. It's founder, Anand Kumar, is a wonderful mathematics teacher and is quite well known. Recently, a Bollywood movie was released that was based on his biography.
  4. I was amongst the few Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya students who were selected in 2008 for IIT-JEE (an extremely competetive entrance examination for admission into the premiere Indian Institutes of Technology) coaching program arranged free of cost by Dakshana foundation— a non-profit organisation. I did my partial JEE preparation under the guidance of very good teachers but had to leave the program midway due to some reasons.
